title: Room in NE Portland Home
postBody:
One room available in a beautiful, spacious inner NE Portland home, ideally located within close walking distance to both Alberta and Williams (great bars and restaurants!), close to two (TWO!!) New Seasons, and just a jaunt to Mississippi (more bars and restaurants!). Close to multiple bus lines (6, 72, 4, 44), and Safeway is literally across the street. The house features hardwood floors, built-in cabinets, and lots of natural light.

Amenities:
*Washer/dryer on site
*Outdoor Grill
*Big-screen TV (HBO/cable)
*Two Full Bathrooms
*1 Large storage area
*Fireplace

The room: Fully finished basement room with big closet. You would share a bathroom with one cleanly individual. Basement also contains plenty of storage space and a half kitchen.

Us:

Claire: 24, wannabe anthropologist who loves popcorn, hoppy beers, Virginia Woolf, Joni Mitchell, This American Life, and British period pieces.

Liam: 24, gay, recent college grad, Harry Potter and philosophy enthusiast, Bay Area sports fan (transplant from there), can make a mean grilled cheese sandwich.

Jennie: 25, Portland native (mostly), I'm into running, yoga, and am kept pretty busy with working at a community health clinic and going to school a couple nights a week.

Evan: 28, delightful, bearded gentleman with a flair for thoughtful political repartee by the fireside. (Jenny wrote that) I also like videogames and beer.

You:
We all enjoy our independent lives, but value communal living. We are looking for someone who enjoys house hangouts on a fairly regular basis and wouldn't mind participating in an impromptu dance party in the dining room every once in awhile. We try to keep communal spaces neat and tidy, so we're looking for someone who will do the same. Sorry, no couples or pets.

The Nitty Gritty:
We're looking for someone to move in on February 1st. We'll need to submit an application for you to our landlord, so ideally we'll have the process wrapped up by mid-January. Your monthly rent will be $460, and we split utilities five ways. Typically, they end up costing about $60/month. We'll need first and last month's rent, a $300 refundable deposit, and a $40 application fee, so your total move-in costs would be $1,260.

If you think you might be a good fit, please respond to this post via email and tell us a little about yourself. We can't wait to meet you!

title: Incredible top floor of N. Mississippi St. house
postBody:
The top floor of our house is for rent. It's a beautiful place, definitely one of the best rentals in the historic Mississippi Street neighborhood, and at an excellent price. It's about 1100 square feet, with its own full bathroom (with slate floor and huge slate shower). It has beautiful wood floors, vaulted ceilings, many windows with good light and views of the neighborhood, the West Hills and Mt Hood. It has a small wet-bar area, a walk-in closet, two more large storage closets and French doors that open onto a small porch overlooking the neighborhood. And it's a good one. We're one block from all the shops, bars, restaurants, etc. on Mississippi Street, with a park two blocks away.

The space for rent is the top floor of a large 3 story renovated house/duplex. The first floor of the house is an entirely separate apartment from us. They're good neighbors. On the second floor are two occupied bedrooms, a full bathroom, laundry room, living room and beautifully remodeled full kitchen. You'll have the entire third floor to yourself. The two floors are connected via stairs, but there is NO door between the two floors. So it's a house-share with two other people, but really there is so much room up there that it's like its own apartment.

The folks on the second floor: two dudes (me, I'm B, and my friend J). We're in our early 40's, we're both into bikes and a variety of outdoor pursuits. We have our own lives but sometimes meet up for beers. We're pretty quiet at the house, but sound does travel between the 2nd and 3rd floors, so we're looking for someone who is also fairly quiet. Let's see...what else? We keep regular hours. We try to keep a somewhat clean house (but we are guys, so it's never super clean.) Of course the kitchen, laundry room and living room are open for you to use as much as you like. Or if you want to mostly keep to the third floor (which is not shared, it's all yours), that's fine too.

OK, the final details: Rent is 890/month, plus 1/3 utilities (about 75-150 each person, depending on the season). We have gas heat/AC and Wi-Fi internet. We don't have cable TV, but you can get your own. No smoking anything in the house. We're looking for ONE person (a guy will probably be the best fit for this place) who preferably has some similar traits to us, is drug-free and drama-free, clean and easy to get along with, and who definitely has the ability to pay rent each month on time. You'll need to sign on to the current lease with the rental management company. They just want to run a credit check and make sure you can pay the rent. No pets are allowed. The rental is available January 1st or later (pro-rated). It's a great place; we've been here for many years. The previous roommate was here for 3 years, but he just bought a house.
If you're interested, email me a few details about yourself and any questions you may have. We're hoping to fill it as soon as possible. It always gets taken fast, so if you think you want it, don't wait.

title: Free Room & Board for Nanny Services
postBody:
I'm a 30 year old, single, working lady. I have a great, stable job and a baby on the way, due in April. I have a two bedroom duplex, with Dish, high speed Internet and meals to share. I work at the office 3 days per week (trying to negotiate down to two) and telework from home the remaining work days. I can't afford daycare. I am looking for a woman with childcare experience dealing with newborns and infants and willing to care for my child from 8am to 6pm 2 to 3 days per week and help me out during days I work from home. I'm not able to pay a salary, but I'm willing to cover rent, food, utilities, and reasonable/negotiable living expenses. You are also welcome to have another part time job outside hours I need nanny help.

You'd have your own bedroom, but share the bathroom. The bedroom has a futon, but I'd be willing accommodate your bedroom furniture or help furnish with new furniture off Craigslist.

Duplex has a deck with a nice view, yard (not fully fenced, you can garden, carport and extra parking spots, it's walking distance from lots of stores, library, post office and Gresham city hall Max station, right on bus lines 9 and 87.

This is obviously down the road a few months, but I wanted to start the search and put out feelers.

I will do a background check and require a drug free environment (sans 420 when I'm around).

title: Two rooms available off SE 87th and Flavel
postBody:
Two Rooms for rent
Each is 425 plus ¼ utilities.
Dogs negotiable, but only if they get along well with the animals already living at the house.

Who lives here:

Andrea: The home owner. My super awesome and ambitious girlfriend who just bought a house! And she's only 25! She is a recent graduate from Pacific University, and is now working at a residential treatment facility. She has 3 animals which I will describe shortly. She realllllllly likes anything Buffy, SVU, V for Vendetta, and Magic the Gathering related.

Angela (myself): I am the home owners girlfriend. I'm a pretty shy and quiet person. I work at a French immersion school, and am a student at PSU. I enjoy a quiet environment. I prefer reading and doing puzzles over going out at night.

Jance: I just want to get the worst out of the way first. So Jance is an interesting dog. He is an old Australian Shepard. He really likes balls, so men proceed with caution (I joke). He can be intimidating when you first meet him, but if you can get past the initial barking when introduced you'll come to realize that he isn't at all aggressive like he sounds at first. The thing to be aware of most about Jance is his stinky farts, they will kill on impact.

Olivia: She is a really cute 9 month old German Shepard mix. She will be going through some training soon which will hopefully make her the perfect dog.

Fox: He's my favorite. He's also a cat (who thinks he's a dog sometimes). Him and Olivia are best friends and its adorable.

About the house and environment:
Andrea bought it within the last month and we have worked hard to refurbish the whole house. The exterior hasn't, but will soon, be painted. The house is fully furnished expect for the bedrooms. There's a decent sized back yard with room for garden space. There is lots of parking. We both like the house to be clean (her more so than I) so it is important that you pick up after yourself.

We're looking for someone who is responsible, quiet, has a reliable income, and doesn't do drugs or drink heavily. No kids, age range is early 20's to mid 30's. We are both sober so there will be no parties, but we don't mind that there's alcohol in the house. We'd like housemates who we can have conversations with and sometimes hangout together. Please tell us about yourself. Your age, occupation, hobbies, etc.

Thank you.

title: Room for rent Must Love dogs! Female Only
postBody:
My husband and I have a 3 bedroom 2.5bath 1800+sq ft home in Troutdale and are looking for a roommate to help pay the mortgage. The room is available Jan 1st.

We have 5 indoor dogs and a large fenced yard. All are Havanese Poodle mixes that are around 10lbs each. We are looking for not only a person we can live with, but that will treat our dogs like their own family. If you are not a dog lover then you would not be happy with us. No cats. I also board dogs here at the house.

We have a 10'x12' bedroom available as pictured below with a full bathroom directly across the hall from it. This would be your bathroom exclusively and has a tub shower combo.

We would share the rest of the house excluding our bedrooms and bathroom. The $450 would cover all utilities including internet and TV. We have some small space in the garage for extra storage but not much.

We have a lovely front loader washing machine and dryer, gas stove, gas fireplace and a 400sqft deck. The house backs up to trees and a small walking trail that runs throughout the neighborhood and down towards downtown Troutdale. Also a small pond in the back yard perfect for summer relaxing.
The house is in a very nice quiet cul de sac built in 1996 and filled with upper middle class families with lots of children and trees. We are close to Mount Hood community college but not within walking distance. It's 2 miles away. We are less than 5 minutes by car to grocery stores, library, Walmart or the outlet mall. There is room in the driveway to park your car as the garage is used for storage. Your car must be in running condition.

We are looking for a Female roommate who is mature (over 25), responsible, EMPLOYED and pays her bills on time.

I am 36 and my husband is 50 so anywhere near those ages would be good. (I'm kind of an old soul and he's rather immature so we both act around 40) I am home a great deal but my husband works out of town and so will only be home on his days off. He is here about 60% of the time. He may stay for a week, then be gone for a week type thing.

Some of his interests are hiking, camping, windsurfing, surfing, snowboarding and being active.

Some of mine are reading, computers, anything to do with dogs, Vintage VWs, going to the theater, belly dance, cooking, art, poi spinning and music.

We are pretty open minded people and hope you will be too. We are LBGT friendly. We will not push our religious beliefs on you and expect you not to push yours on us. We are not neat freaks but we aren't total slobs either. We recycle and are energy conscious. We like to keep the house temperature around 66-70 degrees whenever possible. We are meat eaters. My decorating style is very eclectic and colorful. We are 420 friendly but will not tolerate cigarettes. (asthma) I am allergic to most perfume so I am seriously hoping to find a woman who doesn't wear any. We don't have company over all that often. We would like to find someone who will live with us for a while, we don't want to be the neighborhood flop house. No cats.

Must have good references. Proof of stable employment as well as a $400 deposit.


If after all this you are still interested then send an email.


Feel free to ask us any questions. The house is in the Strawberry Meadows neighborhood of Troutdale.

title: Room for rent. Available 3/1
postBody:
I have a room to rent in my home in SE Portland. I would be happy to do short term or longer term.

Moderate alcohol use is OK, but no heavy drinkers, daily marijuana users or hard drugs
.
About me: 43 (act a bit younger), medical social worker at Providence. I enjoy cooking, running, dancing, traveling, road trips, nature, hanging out with friends. I'm friendly, pretty neat/clean, somewhat quiet at home, since I need to unwind from my job. I work M-F 9-5. I generally go to bed early during the week.

I'm progressive and open-minded, LGBT friendly. I am open to being friends and social on occasion, but mostly will be doing my own thing. I have a newish boyfriend that has his own place, but would be here at times. I have a lot of friends and I'm out a fair bit, but don't entertain at home a whole lot. My house is small enough that we would be interacting a fair bit while we are here, so it is important to be friends and get along well. Good sized bedroom and shared living spaces and bathroom. The kitchen is nice and I have a lot of pots/pans/cooking utensils. The backyard is huge (feel free to garden- I don't!) and great in the summertime.

I would rent the room for 600/mo, includes utilities. It's a nice cozy home with a big back yard, which is great for barbecues and lying in the hammock. If you like to garden, it's perfect, though I don't do a whole lot, since I'm busier than I'd like to be. That said- you'd have the place to yourself quite a bit.

My place is not really big enough for more than one roommate (it's about 1130 sq feet). I don't have pets, but like small dogs and cats, but you would have to be the one taking care of the pet full time.

Since I own the home, I plan on doing all the basic house maintenance, etc, but roommate would need to keep common spaces clean and help out some around the house (garbage, recycling, dishes) I'm clean, so cannot live with really messy people, but don't get too uptight either.

I'd love to hear from you if interested!

We are in need of a roommate that would be able to afford roughly $400/mo. The breakdown of this amount can be found at the bottom of this ad. We are also asking a $200 security deposit that you would of course get back once our deposit comes in after the lease is up.

postBody:
Entire upper level of inner SE house for rent. There's a bedroom with a built in closet, and a hallway that leads to your own extra large walk in closet (with a window) or student/office area if you'd prefer.

Shared bathroom. There's lots of shelf space and we keep it tidy :)

Shared kitchen. Basically we have all the pots and pans and dishes etc that can be accommodated (all for shared use of course) but there's shelf and fridge space for your food stuff.

Shared washer and dryer in the basement.

There are also large planter boxes in the backyard, and if you're so inclined you're welcome to take over one and grow veggies and whatnot :)

Your housemates:
Rachel, Katherine and Amy (that's me!) - we're all graduate students at Portland State University. We work hard and like to have a chill study environment during the week, but like to go out dancing or hiking or just kick back on the weekends. We'd like to keep the respectful, laid back, community atmosphere here.

I have an overly friendly cat and a small friendly (licky) dog. Sorry, no more pets.

The perks:
The house is super cute, with big back and front yards. It's right off of Powell (all the convenience with none of the traffic). The 9 bus goes directly from the bottom of our street to downtown/the PSU campus in 11 minutes. You'll have your own level so you can be as social or reclusive as you want.

The catch:
There's a narrow spiral staircase to get to the upper level. A queen mattress can go up the stairs with a little effort, but not any large preassembled furniture.

Move in is 1 month's rent + 800 deposit (deposit payment plan can be worked out if necessary). You'll pay 25% of the utilities. We have high speed internet but no cable TV.

The house is spacious and welcoming; common spaces have some room for your input (no tvs in common spaces except basement). Enormous yard.

We hope to keep basement space for our occasional guests, however, no extra live-ins: know what i mean jelly bean! Gas stove, gas heat, wood floors. The house/yard/patio/firepit are conducive to sporadic parties...

Roommate X's 13 year old wizard dog lives here and roommate B's 7 year old dog too. Roommate B allergic to cats . . . but other creepy crawly critters can come ...

plz bring good luck charms and sensible shoes.

i am a minimalist consumer who thinks the Bins are a treasure trove!
Painting ~drawing~swinginging~dancing~conversing~gardening~
camping and all matters of creativity and tomfoolery spin my world!
i am a scent sensitive being into alternative ways of living. i am a pseudo omnivore who respects your choice~ i am aware of space ad energy and need the same ...

my goal for the household is to be a work in progress, celebrating victories and practicing tolerance. . .

40-something, queer, overeducated former professor who is now trying hand at being a writer. I have lived all over the US, and some abroad. Political and intellectual lefty, dark humor, dog person, work from home. I cook a lot, read, trying to learn more about all Portland has to offer. I tend to get along well with people late 20s to 60, in the sense of energy, responsibility and sociability. Things I like in random order: Hindi, bowling, Strangers with Candy, going to river beaches with dog(s), cooking thai and Indian food (like to share food when possible), KZME . . . slight shame: fondness for science fiction and horror genres in film and books, though also into all those indie and art house films, and given research and education, read a ridiculous amount of nonfiction. title: roommate wanted in SW!
postBody:
hi! My name's katie, I'm looking for someone to fill the other room in my two bedroom apartment in Hillsdale when my roommate moves to eugene at the end of the month.

I'll post pictures when I get back into town Tuesday.

I'm 23 and a geography/gis student at portland state. i do a lot of outdoorsy stuff (hiking, backpacking, etc) and i love to cook/bake. I'm super laid back and mostly keep things pretty clean. My cat sprout lives here too (I'd rather not have any other furry pets) and unless you're allergic I can nearly promise you'll love him. I'm quiet for the most part other than occasionally playing music through the TV while I'm cooking or whatever. If something i do bothers you and you point it out to me I won't be offended! I never really have parties because the apartment isn't that big but I like having friends over sometimes for movies/food/420/etc and I'll do my best to give you some notice before they show up. I'm totally open minded and accepting and I'm looking for someone who is also.

The room isn't huge but it's a decent size. it's big enough to fit a queen sized bed with room to walk around and I'll try to get the square footage when I post the pictures. there's a nice closet and a ceiling fan and it has a southwest facing window with plenty of daylight. it's on the second floor and the neighbors generally aren't very loud but the road can be a little noisy in the summer when the windows are open. it's right around the corner from the burlingame Freddy's and the 12 and 94 bus lines. the 1 to downtown stops right in front of the building on weekdays too. utilities range from ~$120 in the winter to ~$70 in the warmest months, total. The lease is month to month but I'm hopefully looking to find someone to stay for a while.

My biggest hope is that we get along! I love having a roommate who I can hang with when we're both home or share meals with every once in a while. i dont want to live wih someone who i have to tolerate, or has to tolerate me. there's no room for any more living room furniture (unless your couch is nicer than mine, haha) but the shared spaces are really shared and I'm more than cool with you throwing your style in. I love decorating but I never really put effort into it so the walls could actually use some stuff on them. I'm open to living with a girl or guy but no couples or children please, sorry!

shoot me an email with questions or to tell me a little about yourself! I'll start meeting people this week.

title: Available now! Huge bedroom in beautiful Belmont apartment
postBody:
Available now! One bedroom in a 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment close in SE in the Buckman/Sunnyside area.

About the apartment:
It's a relatively recently updated building (last 3 years or so) with lots of great touches. Lots of fun features on the property: fire pit (free firewood!), barbecue, patio area outside the apartment. There's coin-op laundry and storage in the common area.

The apartment itself is really spacious and has a seriously upgraded kitchen with lots of storage. Electric stove/oven, fridge, microwave, garbage disposal in the sink. The kitchen and living room are pretty well stocked, so it would be ideal if you had minimal large furniture to move in, but there's plenty of space and we can figure that out later. There is a big glass sliding door that gives beautiful natural light in the apartment. The bathroom has a spacious tub and shower with good water pressure.

The open bedroom is a really good size, with plenty of room for a queen size bed and dressers, with a double lighted closet with fully customizable shelves and rods. It also has its own heating vent so you can control the temperature of your bedroom, and it has cable hookups in case you want a TV in there.

Overall, it's a really beautiful apartment in a great location. There are tons of bars and restaurants within walking distance on Belmont and Stark, and it's just a short walk to either the Hawthorne Safeway or Whole Foods on Burnside.

About me:
I work full time at a local nonprofit, and I currently live with my dog Polly, who is a loving, goofy little mutt who will gladly invite herself into your lap whenever possible. I love cooking vegan food, watching both quality and not-so-quality movies, and sampling all the tater tot-related dishes Portland has to offer. I enjoy having a glass of wine sometimes after work, but keep it pretty chill during the week.

About you:
Clean, considerate and respectful, and employed (can pay rent on time). It would be great if you were also vegan, or okay with keeping a vegan kitchen in the apartment--but let's talk about it! I'd love to share the apartment with someone who is fun to hang out with, but also has their own friend group/stuff going on.

Interested?
Rent is $790/month (which we can pro-rate from when you move in)
$450 deposit (negotiable)
Half of electricity and internet bills each month (other utilities are included. Electricity runs about $90 in the winter, for reference.)
Sorry, no more pets. :(

Please respond to this post via email with some details about yourself (your job, hobbies, lifestyle, etc). Links to social media profiles are always nice!

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Bedroom for rent in 3bdr/2 bath house
postBody:
I live in a lovely 3 bedroom 2 bathroom house, my roommate moved out and I am stuck in a lease until the end of June. I found one roommate and am looking for another to help pay the rent until then. Currently my plan is to move out when my lease is up (at which point you and my other roommate could keep the place) but if we end up with a great dynamic then I may be interested in staying. The room is $500 per month and I ask for a deposit of $500.

It is a cool house in a super quiet neighborhood. Awesome back deck which has hosted many summer dinner parties and BBQs. I painted the place when I moved in so there is lots of color in here. Very close to Barbur blvd (#12 bus) and I-5 on ramps. The house is below street level in a stand of trees so it feels kind of woodsy. I have a big empty garage so there is plenty of storage space. I am super close to Lewis & Clark College and a short bus ride to PSU. The pictures of the orange room is the bigger of the two bedrooms. The bookshelves can go or stay if you like them. I am a 31 year old female working on a graduate degree in marriage family therapy. I love to cook and would love to share some meals with my roommate(s). I eat meat and like to use cast iron. It is not uncommon to find a jar of bacon fat or homemade pickles on my counter. I like to drink and get a little silly on weekends but I know how to be responsible. I am super passionate about my work and find that hang-overs get in the way of doing it well. I read a lot of sci-fi, I crochet, and like to work crosswords. I don't have a tv but I watch movies and shows on my laptop from time to time. I love Doctor Who with all my heart. I keep my house tidy and my kitchen clean but I am not crazy about it. Ideally I would love to live with other people that love what they do and are goal-directed. title: Community Has Jan. Opening
postBody:
Cool room for rent in a large 1970's 5+br house.
One room open Jan. 1st.

We are looking for an addition to our community -- We like to hang out, but we also have our own lives. Food is not communal, but we are gearing up to occasionally have dinner together.
This place is an amazing location once you get to know Portland's wonderful transportation system. It's out of the way enough to have some peace and quiet, but it's close enough to be able to get into town within five or ten minutes (about 45 to get into downtown).
We are in N.E. Portland in the Faloma area, one exit off I-5 before you get to Vancouver.

We also are a start up public benefit non profit so if you know what Monsanto is and are aware of the current environmental and social issues that have been plaguing us you will be a better fit.

We have people here who ride bikes or use public transportation that enjoy our secluded place. We are on an acre of land with one neighbor.

Your room rents at only $420, and we split the electric, wifi, and water. Normal utilities come to around $. There is also a refundable $350 deposit that must be paid. Of course, you get it back provided you don't trash the place and pay your bills.
It's a normal-sized room: not huge, not small; there's decent carpet; the windows face south with a view of our beautiful, lush green backyard. There's a small walk-in closet in the bedroom, too.
The rest of the house has newly put-in, easy-to-clean hardwood floors. We do some good cleaning every couple of weeks.
We aren't bourgeois yuppies; we're down-to-earth people. We're musicians, artists, and college students, activists and all around decent humans.

There's a large food area in the kitchen, plenty of room for cooking and eating. Good fridge, too!
There's a beautiful, giant field for a back yard, and a substantial front yard as well.
We are minutes from Safeway
We have absolutely zero tolerance for hard drugs, but we are 420 friendly.
Sewing, gardening, music, and art are encouraged. We love creativity!
There's garage space for storage and a motorcycle/bicycle if you have one.
There is off-street and on-site parking.
2 awesome indoor-only kitties that don't pee on stuff
We have WIFI, it's the fastest that Comcast that will install in residential homes.
We all pay our bills reliably (and expect you to, too!).
The house is really quite big.
It's quite mellow here. Many of us play music professionally though, and there is often a live band here during the day practicing. It's good stuff, though, and pleasant to hear, as well as to join in if you're musically inclined.
We have Central AC for the summer.

Some of us have to get up early in the morning for work (4am) so this house shuts down in the common areas around 9pm or so.

BELOW IS WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR IN A ROOMMATE:

EMPLOYED, STUDENT or STEADY INCOME
Cleanliness. We don't want to live in a gross house, just clean up after yourself and occasionally help clean the kitchen, bathroom and common areas. This is important to be a team player when it comes to the kitchen as the mindset of "I didn't do that" is a bit immature. We would also be looking at people that are socially stable so we don't have a bunch of strangers living under a roof. We are trying to create a home not a flop house.

No Dogs.
We tried dogs and have one. Dogs are great but their owners suck.
We keep a safe household. There will be no tolerance for hard drugs or aggression.

TOTALLY BE - ok with green herb, a person of peace and tolerance, an artist of any kind, a gamer, a college student, a hippy, a free spirit, a mountain biker, a Clint Eastwood fan, a music fan, gardener, intelligent, witty, mellow, extroverted, shy, funny, happy, goofy, be anything you damn want. Just be respectful.

We are a mix of omnivores and vegetarians.
We don't care how old you are, as long as you can be young at heart but we prefer 25+ if possible.
Couples are welcome.

We would love to meet you and talk about your joining our vibrant community.
If you are interested, send an e-mail! The next step is for you to come by and check the place out.
We are looking for a new roommate asap to replace people moving out in June. .

I cannot take phone calls.
Please try to remember you are not the only one that is responding to this ad and I cannot take extra time to answer questions in detail other then what is here or what can be answered when we meet.

title: PCC students
postBody:
Going to school at portland community college- sylvan? Need an affordable place to live? We offer student housing off campus only 5 miles away from school. We offer a shared roommate program for more affordable living and the full college living experience. This program lets you focus on school, classes, work, and life in general, while leaving the housing hassles to us. Our program allows us to rent the apartment from the community, and then you pay the total amount due monthly for yourself or all the roommates. The rent payment, furniture, and utilities would be the same price each month. In addition, we're the only relocation company that furnishes with bedbug protection covers in each and every unit. Want to learn more? visit us at www.nwstudenthousing.com or call us

title: SE room for rent on Division and 35th
postBody:
Hi,

My name is Miguel and my roommate Phil is moving out sometime this month, so my other roommate John and I are looking for someone to move after February 1st. About the townhouse: it's two floors and all three rooms are upstairs along with a bathroom and shower that you would share with John. Downstairs is the kitchen, dining area, living room, half bathroom, laundry room, garage, and backyard.

About me: I am 28 and work in the financial industry. I am originally from San Francisco and have been in Portland for just over a year. I like cooking, trying new restaurants and bars, although both John and I don't drink a whole lot and we're looking for someone to be along the same lines. I love sports, so I'm typically watching some kind of sport on TV as well as movies and shows. I enjoy hiking and snowboarding and just being active in general. I work a M-F job with an occasional Saturday. I enjoy traveling, so I'm typically going back to the Bay or other places when I can.

John is 31 and works from home in his room. He has his own trading business. He is very chill and enjoys the outdoors too. He is originally from the Midwest but has been in Portland for some time. He enjoys riding his bike and spending time on his computer.

We keep the house pretty clean and expect our new roommate to also be clean, especially in the shared areas of the house. We are looking for someone that has a full-time job/going to school that can pay rent every month along with utilities. We hope our new roommate is respectful, nice, easy to get along with, and trustworthy. We are pretty good about not keeping one another up late or waking one another too early. Loud music is a no and we enjoy having company over but also are not looking to have parties and people getting drunk and being annoying.

We are looking for a single roommate and not couples, kids, nor pets. Utilities are not included, so that means we split electricity, water, sewage, and cable three ways. The cost for the room is $650. You are literally about 50 yards from Division St and in the area where all the new shops, restaurants, bars are opening up. The bus stops are less than a 5 minute walk too. We have really cool and chill neighbors and the neighborhood itself is very safe. The place is fully furnished and I am pretty sure the room will be too if you want. Also, the lease end at the end of April, so you would be taking over Phil's portion of the rent. I don't plan on renewing and I am pretty sure John won't be either. I will most likely be moving back to the Bay Area with work. So that means you have the option of renewing the lease.

If interested please respond and I would enjoy setting a time and day so you can come check the place out and meet John and myself to see if this would be a good fit. If interested, text me at show contact info and I will send you pics of the place and room.


Thanks,

Miguel

title: Buckman House Share
postBody:
Buckman area of SE Portland (a.k.a. Lower Hawthorne) that has two rooms coming available for rent on January 15th. The sum total of roommates is 6 when fully occupied, but there are 3 bathrooms, and LOADS of space. The house was built in 1908, and is an old classic foursquare. This house is huge.The house is over 5000 sq feet, and was originally built as a rooming house.
No, not kidding. Huge.
Enjoy your own room and common space galore! There is a full dining room, living room, TV room, and two sun porches. The backyard is small, but fenced, with a small BBQ pit. Off street parking, and plenty of room for bikes.
VERY IMPORTANT
This house is for sale, although off the market for the month of January. Showings will resume in February. Although it may be sold to an investor, who would likely keep all tenants, a family interested in the house have the right to give you 60 days notice if they choose to occupy the house after a sale. Just sayin'
Moving on...
Both rooms are a good size on the 2nd floor, one is probably 'nicer' than the other, but both have wood floors and sunny windows. If you prefer one over the other, you might want to get in first....or you'll just have to duke it out. There are three bedrooms on this floor of the house, and share one large bath with shower and clawfoot tub. There are two more bathrooms in the house on other floors (okay, technically, there are four baths total, but for your purposes, there are three)
Another dog is up for discussion (apparently cats and dachshunds don't get on?) At this time, I am only renting for one person per room, to keep the house #s in balance. If you are a couple and want both rooms, have at it, no discounts.
*We are particularly looking for CLEAN habits on this round.
No, not chore wheels, just identifying areas needing attendance and what I like to refer to as 'after clean' Did you make a mess? Clean it the f@$* up.

Enjoy the community and sustainability of shared living. Utilities are shared on a point system for gas and electric (about $50/60 a month) everything else including wireless internet is included. Washer and dryer are on the 1st floor (as well as the kitchen)

Please contact me with some information about your situation, and I will arrange something with the current tenants so you can meet and see the house.
I will try to respond to all inquiries, because I know things are tight and competitive, but I am only the first and last gatekeeper, you've still got to appeal to the members of the house.
Some short facts:
No smoking of any product tobacco or otherwise in the house.
Month-to-month agreements, first month and one months deposit to secure the room. (all deposits must clear prior to move in).
The four-legged guardian of the house is a middle-aged dachshund, but is known to get on with others
Carnivore-friendly
Vegan-friendly
LGBT friendly
Oh, and anyone practicing for their next dictatorship should look elsewhere.

title: Seniors Coop/Commune
postBody:
The location is yet to be determined but seeking fairly close in \SW side. I tried to post this on Meet Up but that didn't work, then tried the Srs section of CL and clearly lots of mentally ill people chatting there, so will try again here.

I am working on building a very friendly shared housing arrangement for seniors. One where we would rent a house for low cost but in good, clean, nice area and by transport. The object is to provide an environment where we help each other instead of relying on family (whose often not available), and the massive bureaucracy, including care providers that's steal, don't like their job or are squatters. I figure if like 5 or so of us got together and helped each other, i.e. my bad day is your good day, etc as well as providing companionship through the challenges of aging, it could be a way good thing. To make it better would be to have at least one bedrm shared so rent is lower.
I do feel there needs to be requirements though, as clearly mental illness is pretty rampant and if not that, then just people who don't have a clue as to what it takes to share space with others in a peaceful and constructive manners. We can discuss the rules too, but for now they are;
1. Must not have mental health issues, (intermittent brain fog or moodiness is ok)
2. Must be able to discuss any issues without arguing or fighting
3. Must be intelligent with good sense of humor and into constructive things
4. Must be cat and smoker tolerant (ie smells on clothing etc as smoking will be outside)

Im working on being able to obtain housing that will cost ea person approx $200 for rent and then their share of utilities/intenet/tv (hence I reflect $250 which maybe a little off but not much, I don't think).

If interested let me know. Once I have connected with like 7 people I will set an initial meeting downtown (convenient to all) where we can meet and chat. Then I think we should all meet say 5 times so we have a good sense of each other. Maybe meeting at each others current residence if workable.

Look forward to hearing from you.

title: Eco Friendly Living for Women
postBody:
Kailash Ecovillage is a sustainably based intentional community with plenty of garden space and bike parking. This is shared housing for earth friendly Women. Would you like to live with others who share your passion for the environment? Have you ever wanted to live in an intentional community? Then you will love this great housing option. Our apartment complex has just remodeled one of our units to be shared housing with lovely bamboo flooring and granite counter tops. It is close to Reed College and also very easy to get to PSU by bike or bus. Everyone in our community has been selected for their dedication to recycling, composting and sustainability. We have around an acre of vegetable gardens!

A private bedroom and bathroom, shared kitchen and dining with one other woman. 12-month lease.

If you have an interest in viewing our sustainable living property then please send us a quick email about your experience with sustainable living and we can set up a tour date for you. Rent is $695 per month plus utilities.

Note: Non Smokers Only, No Pets
